Articles.Content:
Are they gone ? I have unlocked probes, been to Mun and Minmus, i have unlocked antennas, upgraded research lab etc... And no satellite contracts...

**Edited <time datetime="2015-05-04T16:20:44Z" title="05/04/2015 04:20  PM" data-short="9 yr">May 4, 2015</time> by Hcube**
they are still in the game; not sure why you aren't getting any satellite contracts.
Probably you haven't unlocked solar panels?
They won't start appearing until you have at least the lowest level solar panel, which is quite a way into the tech tree.

I do have unlocked solar panels and batteries, along with 2 different probe cores and the first 2 antennas. I even have 0.625m parts such as decouplers, adapters, etc.

And yet no satellite contracts. I only seem to get rescue or tourists contracts (the latter being even more dull than satellites ones if you ask me).

I play almost stock ; i only have Chatterer installed.

then it should appear after rejecting several existing contracts. they don't appear that often as it was in 0.90

tourism is dull, agree. but, in 1.0.x I think rescue is more attractive than satellite now... satellite now have no science if no additional equipment, and doesn't reward as much as rescues - rescues rewards are competitive by itself, plus it saves your hiring cost (which is a LOT), plus it's possible to batch them up (in the sense that you can accept rescue contracts after launching a rescue vessel). imagine I got several probe+hitchhiker or even just 2 pods on orbit just waiting for incoming rescues...

How about firing those rescued kerbals ? I remember there was a bug that if you fired kerbal that had some experience it could break your save in some way (can't remember how exactly). Is this bug gone now ? Can i fire unwanted kerbals without fear ?

> 
> How about firing those rescued kerbals ? I remember there was a bug that if you fired kerbal that had some experience it could break your save in some way (can't remember how exactly). Is this bug gone now ? Can i fire unwanted kerbals without fear ?

I would just not try it... There is no reason to fire a kerbal, and if there's a risk that it might break the game, then.... just keep the kerbals x)
Firing Kerbals? The hiring cost makes the rescue missions *extremely* attractive.
